question: Question_A_27
statement:
Suppose that \emph{A} is an $8 \times 8$ invertible matrix and \emph{b}
is a column vector with 8 entries. Both \emph{A} and \emph{b} have been
entered into MATLAB. What commands would you use to compute the vector
\textbf{x} that solves the linear system

\[A \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}?\]
sols:
If we have a linear system

\[A\mathbf{x}=\mathbf{b}\]

then Matlab can solve this via the \textbackslash{} operator. Therefore
if we type

\texttt{x=A\textbackslash{}b;}

then the vector \emph{x} produced by Matlab is the solution to the
linear system.

\textbf{Note.} Since \emph{A} is invertible, it is possible to get the
solution by typing

\texttt{x=inv(A)*b;}

but you are generally discouraged from using the inv() operation in
Matlab to solve linear systems. (That's because calculating the inverse
of a matrix \emph{A} is an overkill here, there is faster ways of
finding \emph{x} that don't require the matrix inverse.)
hints: What is the special Matlab command for solving a linear system?
